meanings.definition: A humorous five-line poem with a specific rhyme scheme (AABBA).
meanings.sent1: Kids at the party giggled at the silly limericks.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed writing limericks to make her friends laugh.
meanings.sent3: The comedian entertained the audience with limericks about chickens.
meanings.sent4: His limericks were like little bursts of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The limericks painted colorful pictures in the listeners' minds.

meanings.definition: A type of verse characterized by its witty and often obscene content.
meanings.sent1: The book contained limericks that made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent2: Some limericks are cleverly crafted to surprise the reader.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa blushed when he accidentally read an inappropriate limerick.
meanings.sent4: Her limericks were sharp arrows of humor hitting the target.
meanings.sent5: The limericks danced on the edge of decency, teasing the imagination.

meanings.definition: A form of poetry originating in Ireland.
meanings.sent1: The students studied limericks as part of Irish literature.
meanings.sent2: Limericks have a distinct Irish charm in their rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The leprechaun recited limericks under the rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her limericks were like a taste of Ireland in every line.
meanings.sent5: The limericks sang of green hills and mischievous fairies.
